Paper.Title: A Question Answering System Supported by Information Extraction*

Section.Paragraph: This paper discusses an information extraction (IE) system, Textract, in natural language (NL) question answering (QA) and examines the role of IE in QA application. It shows: (i) Named Entity tagging is an important component for QA, (ii) an NL shallow parser provides a structural basis for questions, and (iii) high-level domain independent IE can result in a QA breakthrough.

Introduction With the explosion of information in Internet, Natural language QA is recognized as a capability with great potential. Traditionally, QA has attracted many AI researchers, but most QA systems developed are toy systems or games confined to lab and a very restricted domain. More recently, Text Retrieval Conference (TREC-8) designed a QA track to stimulate the research for real world application.
